title: Courses
content:
APEST Courses

Take Your APEST Skills to the Next Level

Join others from around the world for live, interactive learning experiences

Discover Your Gifts

Identify your unique APEST giftings profile and how it shapes the way you serve and interact with others

Develop APEST Skills

Gain practical skills in each APEST gifting that can be applied in every area of your life and ministry

Journey with Others

Connect with others on the same path to learn, share insights, and support one another in your APEST journey

Design Equipping Pathways

Create customized developmental pathways that foster Christ-like maturity in both individuals and groups

Ready to grow in Christ-like maturity?

Our courses are organized around 6 developmental pathways – APEST Foundations, Apostle, Prophet, Evangelist, Shepherd, and Teacher. Each pathwayis designed to help you grow in a specific area of Christ-like maturity through the fivefold giftings of APEST. Choose a pathway below, take a course, and continue developing from there.

APEST Foundations

Courses that help you develop a strong Scriptural foundation in APEST

View Courses

Apostle

Courses that help you develop apostolic skills and sensibilities 

View Courses

Prophet

Courses that help you develop prophetic skills and sensibilities

View Courses

Evangelist

Courses that help you develop evangelistic skills and sensibilities

View Courses

Shepherd

Courses that help you develop shepherding skills and sensibilities

View Courses

Teacher

Courses that help you develop teaching skills and sensibilities

View Courses

Frequently Asked Questions

Who are the courses for?

Our courses are customized for a diverse range of individuals. Whether you’re an everyday Christian looking to understand more about APEST giftings, a small group or ministry leader, or a leader of a church, church plant, or non-profit, our tailored learning experiences are designed with you in mind.

How do I choose the right online course for me?

To find the best course for you, consider where you are in your APEST journey.

Our Intro Courses are for beginners and help you build a strong foundation for understanding each APEST gifting, and how they can work together for our health and maturity. 

Our Equipping Courses are for people who have a basic understanding of APEST but want to take develop the skills and sensibilities of each APEST gifting in themselves, and/or those around them.

Each course description on our website provides detailed information to help you make an informed decision.

Are the courses pre recorded or “live”?

We offer both live and pre-recorded course. All live courses are labeled with a red “live”. If there is no red “live” label, then it is a pre-recorded online course.

Can I take pre-recorded courses at my own pace?

Absolutely! Our online pre-recorded courses are designed for your convenience, allowing you to learn at your own pace. 

We understand that everyone has different schedules and learning styles, so our pre-recorded courses are available 24/7 to all particpants. 

Is there a deadline to complete a pre-recorded online course?

While our pre-recorded online courses are self-paced, they typically come with a recommended timeframe for completion to keep you on track – anywhere from 6 to 8 weeks depending on the course.

However, to accommodate different learning speeds and schedules you will have access to all course material 24/7 for the lifetime of your account. This will allow you to come back to courses and materials and access the content anytime you want.  

What is the refund policy for courses?

We stand by the quality of our courses, but we also understand that circumstances can change. Our refund policy is designed to be fair and transparent. Please refer to our ‘Terms and Conditions‘ for detailed information on refunds.

Can I interact with instructors or other students in the online courses?

Yes, if you take one of our live courses (which is most of them), you’ll have time for group discussions and Q&A sessions to help process the content. 

A few courses are pre-recorded, so no live interaction is possible. However, everyone who takes a course is invited to join our Facebook Group, where you can connect with other students, share insights, ask questions, and continue learning together. The group helps build a supportive community, offering ongoing discussions even after the course ends.

What if I encounter technical issues while taking a course?

We are dedicated to making sure your learning experience is enjoyable and meaningful. If you encounter any issues, you can reach out to us via email at support@trimtab.guideor or our website’s contact form and we will seek to resolve it in the quickest and most efficient way possible.

Are there any prerequisites for enrolling in online courses?

Some of our advanced courses may have prerequisites, which are clearly listed in the course description. However, the Intro Courses are designed so that anyone can step in and move forward in their APEST journey without any prior reading or experience.

What kind of practical experience will I gain from these courses?

Our courses are designed with a strong emphasis on practical, hands-on learning. You’ll not only be introduced to paradigm shifting content, each course will include practical exercises you can do to apply APEST right where you live, learn, work, and play.

Is there a trial period for online courses?

While we don’t offer a trial period, we provide detailed course descriptions so you can understand the course content and structure before making a commitment.

After completing a course, can I get ongoing support or resources?

Yes, definitely! Completing a course doesn’t mean the end of your APEST journey with us.

Everyone who participates in a course is invited to join a private Facebook Group where you can connect, share insights, and grow together with others in their APEST journey. 

For those who want more focused investment, you can enroll in our Co-Lab where APEST practitioners and equippers meet bi-weekly for ongoing coaching and consulting with Tim on how to maximize APEST in their context. See Co-Lab at the top of the page for more details.
